snippet: Al Qaeda’s leader, Ayman al-Zawahri, has indicated that he views Syria as a promising staging ground, and officials are concerned that a base there could present a rising threat to Israel and Europe.
abstract: American intelligence and counterterrorism officials are concerned that jihadist militants aligned with Al Qaeda could establish a base in Syria capable of threatening Israel and Europe; new signs of energized but fragmented jihadist threat have complicated narrative of weakened Al Qaeda that Pres Obama offered in May speech heralding end of war on terrorism.

byline.original: By ROBERT F. WORTH and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Al Qaeda’s leader, Ayman al-Zawahri, has indicated that he views Syria as a promising staging ground, and officials are concerned that a base there could present a rising threat to Israel and Europe.

headline.main: Jihadist Groups Gain in Turmoil Across Middle East
headline.print_headline: Jihadist Groups Gain in Turmoil Across Mideast

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
